statements.name: PROC FISM
statements.description: The FISM procedure performs frequent item set mining, which looks for frequent patterns in a large database. The FISM procedure finds frequent patterns by using the FP-growth (frequent-pattern growth) algorithm of Han, Pei, and Yin (2000). The FP-growth algorithm uses a special data structure called the frequent-pattern tree (FP-tree), which retains the item set association information. â€  The FISM procedure is used by other procedures such as the MBANALYSIS procedure for association rule mining.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: Names the input data table for PROC FISM to use. CAS-libref.data-table is a two-level name, where

arguments.name: ITEMS=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of items in a frequent item set, where number must be an integer between 1 and 1,000. By default, ITEMS=2 when you specify the OUT= option in the OUTPUT statement; otherwise, ITEMS=1 by default. This option is ignored if you specify the NFIS_RANGE= option.

arguments.name: NFIS_RANGE=
arguments.description: Specifies the range of number of items in the frequent item sets, where number must be an integer between 1 and 1,000.

arguments.name: PCTSUP=
arguments.description: Specifies the minimum level of support for a rule as a percentage of the number of baskets in the input data table, where number must be a real number between 0 and 100, inclusive. This option is ignored if the SUPPORT= option is specified.

arguments.name: SUPPORT=
arguments.description: Specifies the minimum level of support (minimum frequency of an item) for a rule, where number must be an integer greater than or equal to 0. This option overrides the specification of the PCTSUP= option.

statements.name: CUSTOMER
statements.description: The CUSTOMER statement groups one or more specified target variables into a basket. You can also specify this statement as ID variables.

statements.name: OUTPUT
statements.description: The OUTPUT statement specifies output tables that contain result of FISM procedure.

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: The OUTPUT statement creates a data table to contain the predicted target values of the input table CAS-libref.data-table is a two-level name, where

arguments.name: OUTFREQ=
arguments.description: Creates a data table that contains information about the unique frequent items with their transaction counts and support. CAS-libref.data-table is a two-level name, where CAS-libref refers to the caslib and session identifier, and data-table specifies the name of the output data table.

statements.name: TARGET
statements.description: The TARGET statement specifies a single nominal variable to use as the target variable. If this variable is not present in the input data table, then PROC FISM exits with an error.
